verses.roman:
imāṁ vakṣyaty asau sūta
ṛṣibhyo naimiṣālaye
dīrgha-satre kuru-śreṣṭha
sampṛṣṭaḥ śaunakādibhiḥ

synonyms: imam—this; vakṣyati—will speak; asau—present before us; sūtaḥ—Sūta Gosvāmī; ṛṣibhyaḥ—to the sages; naimiṣa-ālaye—in the forest of Naimiṣa; dīrgha-satre—at the lengthy sacrificial performance; kuru-śreṣṭha—O best of the Kurus; sampṛṣṭaḥ—questioned; śaunaka-ādibhiḥ—by the assembly led by Śaunaka.
translation: O best of the Kurus, the same Sūta Gosvāmī who is sitting before us will speak this Bhāgavatam to the sages assembled in the great sacrifice at Naimiṣāraṇya. This he will do when questioned by the members of the assembly, headed by Śaunaka.
